questions.promptMd: Which outline best reflects the inverted pyramid for an update email?

answers.contentMd: Headline TL;DR → 3 bullets → CTA → appendix links
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Most important first, details later.
Buried ask and long background violates BLUF.

answers.contentMd: Five paragraphs of narrative then bullets
Multiple CTAs at top and bottom

questions.promptMd: True or False: Signposting with headings and labels helps scanners grasp structure quickly.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Headings and labels guide attention.

questions.promptMd: Which element most reduces cognitive load?

answers.contentMd: Chunking content into short paragraphs and bullets
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Chunking aids memory and scanning.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Formatting (bold, monospace) should support semantic structure rather than replace it.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Start with structure; use formatting to reinforce.
Styling alone can’t fix a poor structure.
